A lot of twists and deaths. I feel like: It's better than ep. 7 for sure\, and is strong in some areas\, but falls flat on its face in others. It's my opinion that Luke Skywalker was done 100% dirty in the way the character was written this time around. This version of Luke had nothing to do with the Luke we all know and love. The casino side-story was pretty pointless and did nothing for the plot. Also that battle scene was a pretty obscene rip-off the battle in ep. 5. Is there no such thing as creativity anymore? Not that Disney cares\, as long as it's profitable....
